intro: Anemopaegma rugosum, commonly known as the rough anemopaegma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features rough, hairy stems and leaves, which provide it with a distinctive texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Anemopaegma rugosum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky habitats.
